Key Arguments: The legislation contains broad and subjective definitions that could be politically loaded.
The definition of harm is too expansive and could target religious beliefs and traditional views.
Exclusions for professional news content and government-authorized content are hypocritical.
The bill could restrict free speech and debate on important issues like climate change.
A healthy democracy requires freedom of speech across the ideological spectrum.
Notable Quotes: I believe that there is a great danger in framing legislation which contains politically-loaded, unnecessarily broad, and highly subjective definitions.
As a Christian, I worry that this legislation could be used particularly to target religious platforms or individuals who hold religious beliefs.
I find that these exclusions are utterly hypocritical.
A healthy, functioning democracy requires freedom of speech, which means that ideas from across the ideological and political spectrum can be discussed and debated by anyone.
